sen.j: 大友 氏時（おおとも うじとき、? - 1368年4月8日（正平 (日本)23年/応安元年3月21日 (旧暦)））は南北朝時代 (日本)の守護大名。
sen.e: OTOMO Ujitoki (Birth date unknown-April 8th, 1368) was a Shugo Daimyo (feudal lord) during the Nanbokucho Era (the period of the Northern and Southern Courts of Japan).
Ujitoki OTOMO (Birth date unknown - April 8, 1368) was a Shugo Daimyo (feudal lord) in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts of Japan.
Ujitoki OTOMO (Birth date unknown - April 8, 1368) was a Shugo Daimyo (feudal lord) in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts of Japan.
He was the 8th family head.
He was the 8th family head of Otomo clan.
He was the 8th family head of Otomo clan.

sen.j: 父は第6代当主・大友貞宗。
sen.e: His father was the 6th family head, OTOMO Sadamune.
His father was the 6th family head, Sadamune OTOMO.
His father was the 6th family head, Sadamune OTOMO.

sen.j: 母は少弐盛経の娘（異説あり）。
sen.e: His mother was SHONI Moritsune's daughter. (There are varied theories on this.)
His mother was Moritsune SHONI's daughter. (There are varied theories on this.)
His mother was Moritsune SHONI's daughter (there are various theories on this).
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を修正しました。

sen.j: 足利尊氏の寵愛を受け、その猶子となる。
sen.e: He was a favorite of ASHIKAGA Takauji, who considered him as his own.
He was in favor with Takauji ASHIKAGA and became an adopted son of his.
He was in favor with Takauji ASHIKAGA and became an adopted son of his.

sen.j: 正平17年/貞治元年(1362年)、異母兄・大友氏泰の死により家督を継いで当主となった。
sen.e: In 1362, with the death of his stepbrother, OTOMO Ujiyasu, he inherited the family estate and was made family head.
In 1362, with the death of his older paternal half-brother, Ujiyasu OTOMO, he inherited the family estate and was made to be the family head.
In 1362, with the death of his older paternal half-brother, Ujiyasu OTOMO, he inherited the family estate and was made to be the family head.

sen.j: 当時の九州では南朝 (日本)勢力の菊池武光の勢力が強かったため、北朝 (日本)側の氏時は少弐頼尚と共同して菊池軍と戦った。
sen.e: At the time, KIKUCHI Takemitsu of the Nancho (Southern Court of Japan) wielded great power, and so Ujitoki (who was part of the Northern Court of Japan) joined with SHONI Yorinao to fight KIKUCHI's army.

In Kyushu at the time, Takemitsu KIKUCHI of the Nancho (Southern Court of Japan) was dominant in power, so Ujitoki (who was on the side of Northern Court of Japan) cooperated with Yorinao SHONI to fight against KIKUCHI's army.
sen.cmt: In Kyushuを冒頭に追加、その他表現の見直し
sen.e: In Kyushu at the time, Takemitsu KIKUCHI of the Nancho (Southern Court of Japan) was dominant in power, so Ujitoki (who was on the side of Northern Court of Japan) cooperated with Yorinao SHONI to fight against KIKUCHI's army.

sen.j: しかし筑後川の戦いで大敗を喫して大友氏の勢力は衰退する。
sen.e: But OTOMO's army was greatly weakened after suffering a crushing defeat at the Battle of Chikugo-gawa River.
But OTOMO's army was greatly weakened after suffering a crushing defeat at the Battle of Chikugo-gawa River.
But OTOMO's army was greatly weakened after suffering a crushing defeat at the Battle of Chikugo-gawa River.

sen.j: そして敗戦の失意のうちに病に倒れて死去。
sen.e: In despair at the defeat, he fell ill and passed away.
In despair at the defeat, he fell ill and passed away.
In despair at the defeat, he fell ill and passed away.

sen.j: 家督は大友氏継が継いだ。
sen.e: The estate passed to OTOMO Ujitsugu.
The family estate was inherited by Ujitsugu OTOMO.
The family estate was inherited by Ujitsugu OTOMO.
His posthumous Buddist name was "Tenyu".
His posthumous Buddhist name was "Tenyu."
sen.cmt: Buddist をBuddhist に変更（スペル修正）、ピリオドを引用符の中に収容
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name was "Tenyu."
